args: Some time after Yukimura fended off\nthe Mukuroshu invasion...
Yes. Let me see what it says...
Ah, I see. Lord Ieyasu wishes to have\na mock battle between our armies.
A mock battle? Not a one-on-one?
It would appear he was quite impressed\nby your victory against the Mukuroshu.
He says a mock battle would be an\nexcellent way to improve each other's\nskills and be beneficial to both armies.
In other words, the great commander\nIeyasu believes we are a worthy opponent\nfor him.
Sounds like fun to me! We should accept\nhis offer at once, Lady Yukimura.
Oh, you KNOW I'm not turning this down!
The day of the mock battle
Thank you for accepting my sudden\nrequest, Yukimura.
I've been waiting for this, Ieyasu.\nLet's all give it our best today!
I'd not have it any other way.
I look to you to oversee this match,\nShingen.
Well then, keep both those eyes open,\nGeneral, 'cause I'm gonna drag Ieyasu\nup and down the battlefield!
There's no way me and my trusted vassals\nare ever gonna lose!
Along those lines, Yuki, I should tell you\nthat some people have a rather poor\nimpression of you of late.

They believe you're nothing more than
a pretender who relies on her skilled
vassals and reaps the benefits of their
actions and hard work.
I did not believe those rumors, but I also\ncannot ignore them, so I came to ascertain\nthe truth or falseness of them myself.
I once explained to you that you needed to\nrely on your vassals more, but I fear you\nmay have misunderstood my intention.
That's not what's happening, General!\nI swear it isn't!
We shall see the truth of that today.
Ieyasu's army is formidable, and you will\nnot defeat him if you simply rely on others\nto do everything.
If you grasp victory in this mock battle,\nI can put these fell rumors to bed.
If you are to lose, however, I will have no\nchoice but to recognize them as true and\ntake your vassals from you.
Perhaps being separated from them will\nallow you to reflect on yourself and your\nown powerlessness.
Such a terrible fate for us all...
I was only able to fight for Lady Yukimura!\nI have no desire to serve anyone else!
Don't worry about it, everybody.\nAll we have to do is win!
We'll make General Shingen realize that\nwhat we have here is something special!
So I ask all of you to lend me your\nstrength as you always have!
Thus did the mock battle began. However...
Lord Ieyasu's army is even stronger\nthan I had imagined...
As Shingen said, Ieyasu's soldiers surpassed\nYukimura's army in both skill and strength,\nand her situation grew more dire by the moment.
My strategy gave us a temporary reprieve,\nbut it's still not enough to turn the tide\nof battle. If this keeps up...
If I take down Ieyasu in a one-on-one fight,\nthat counts as a win for us!
Milady, no! That's far too reckless!
No. It's not. It's the only way we can win.
Listen up, everyone! We're going to\nabandon our defenses and charge\nstraight into the enemy stronghold!
It's your duty to make sure Lady Yukimura\nmakes it to Lord Ieyasu and claims victory!
So be it. If Lady Yukimura wishes to seize\nthe moment, then I will see it done!
Your faith is giving me strength!
And today, my spear will bring us victory!
Lord Ieyasu, the enemy's army has\nabandoned their defenses and now\ncharges headlong for our stronghold!
So she plans to throw decorum to the wind\nand come straight for me in a final\ndesperate gambit, does she? Clever.
Well, I ain't gonna let 'em lay a finger\non ya! Let's go finish this, Sazanka!
Out of the way! I seek only Lord Ieyasu!
Ninja arts? Pah. It'll take more than that.
He saw through my substitution?\nHe's skilled indeed...
But I won't lose—I must open a path\nfor Lady Yukimura! HAAAAH!
How is this happening? How can they\npossibly hold off both Addis and myself?!
We'll take care of the enemy here,\nLady Yukimura! Make for Lord Ieyasu!
No! She's gonna reach Lord Ieyasu!
Excellent work, Yukimura. I'd not expected\nyou to make it this far.
I was only able to reach you because\neveryone believed in me.
And my spear will ring triumphant because\nit's filled with the trust of my companions!\nNOW COME GET SOOOOOME!
So you DO have a hidden power that\nchanges your appearance! Fascinating...
Well, I wouldn't have it any other way.\nLet us face each other as two fellow\ncommanders in a one-on-one battle!
As both commanders have fallen,\nthis mock battle is a draw.
Which means we didn't win, huh?
But neither did you lose—and more to the\npoint, you held your own against the elite\nforces of Ieyasu's troops.
This is truly praiseworthy! No ordinary\ncommander could possibly accomplish\nsuch a feat!
You demonstrated trust and unity between\nyourself and your vassals, and proved all\nthe rumors unfounded.

You also said your spear was filled with
the trust of your companions, which you
never would have said in the days when
you charged in alone.
And now, I have no qualms in entrusting\nmy own vassals to you when I pass on.
When you PASS ON?! What are you\ntalking about, General?!
I've gotten quite old for a Wyrmclan\nleader, so it's natural to start thinking\nabout what happens after I'm gone.
But I don't want to think about that...

Ha ha! No need for the glum face.
I'm still in the line of duty, after all,
and have no intention of slipping off
quietly without a fight.
More importantly, let us speak of this\nmock battle! You did excellently out there,\nYuki. Don't you agree, Ieyasu?
Indeed, I was able to experience first-hand\nhow powerful your army has become.
You are a dependable Wyrmclan leader\nwho will protect our land with me.\nHinomoto is in excellent hands.
It's quite the feat to get such praise from\nIeyasu. As your mentor, I have much to\nbe proud of.
Eh, I've still got plenty to learn.
And even if it won't be for a while,\nI've gotta work my butt off now that\nyou've entrusted me with your vassals!
I'm gonna prove myself worthy of your\nname and use guts and grit to push\nmyself past ALL of my limits!
